# averageGray

**Instance Property**

The luminance level to use as the midpoint of a tone mapping curve.

## Declaration

```swift
var averageGray: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

When using a High Dynamic Range (HDR) camera, SceneKit applies a process called *tone mapping* to translate the wide range of luminance values in the visible scene to the narrower range of brightness values that can be shown on a display. SceneKit determines a tone mapping curve from the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/minimumExposure], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/maximumExposure], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/exposureOffset], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/whitePoint] properties, along with this property which serves as a constant estimate of scene luminance.

The default value is `0.18`. By setting this property to a higher or lower value, you can compensate for scenes with darker or brighter content. Alternatively, by setting the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/wantsExposureAdaptation] property, you can allow SceneKit to automatically adjust exposure as the visible contents of the scene change.

This property has no effect if the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/wantsHDR] value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. If the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/exposureAdaptationDarkeningSpeedFactor] value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], SceneKit ignores this property, and instead computes the average luminance currently visible to the camera during rendering.

## Adding High Dynamic Range Effects

- **wantsHDR**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit applies High Dynamic Range (HDR) postprocessing effects to a scene.
- **exposureOffset**: A logarithmic bias that adjusts the results of SceneKit’s tone mapping operation, brightening or darkening the visible scene.
- **whitePoint**: The luminance level to use as the upper end of a tone mapping curve.
- **minimumExposure**: The minimum exposure value to use in tone mapping.
- **maximumExposure**: The minimum exposure value to use in tone mapping.
